titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The weather is becoming milder. Rain replaces snow. Two sectaries, a Congregationalist, Hooper, & a Wesleyan, Fletcher, respectively the President & the Secretary of the local organisation of sectaries, came to see me at my request in order to consider the service in the Cathedral on Jan. 6
We agreed that the sectarian ministers sh
be invited to walk in the procession, and that the particular sectaries, Hooper & Fletcher sh
I carried my guests (i.e. the Pembers) to Lumley, where we lunched with Lady L. and saw the house. An American, McClure Robinson, was there.
